result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrel J Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Montrel J Rodriguez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Montrel J Rodriguez was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$300 bail applied toward restitution. Balance due within first 6 months of supervision.
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).
All payments to be applied toward restitution before supervision fees are collected.

No contact with victims: D.O. or M.O.
Submit to DNA sample by 9/24/16 at 12:00pm.
